audit_tests.name: 4.1.1 Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet service file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 755 /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, the kubelet service file has permissions of 640.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.2 Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chown root:root /etc/systemd/system/kubelet.service.d/10-kubeadm.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.3 If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: If kube-proxy is running, and if it is using a file-based kubeconfig file, ensure that the proxy kubeconfig file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 644 <proxy kubeconfig file>
audit_tests.default_value: By default, proxy file has permissions of 640.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.4 If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: If kube-proxy is running, ensure that the file ownership of its kubeconfig file is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chown root:root <proxy kubeconfig file>
audit_tests.default_value: By default, proxy file ownership is set to root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.5 Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chmod 644 /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet.conf file has permissions of 640.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.6 Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Run the below command (based on the file location on your system) on the each worker node. For example,
chown root:root /etc/kubernetes/kubelet.conf
audit_tests.default_value: By default, kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root.

audit_tests.name: 4.1.7 Ensure that the certificate authorities file permissions are set to 644 or more restrictive
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file has permissions of 644 or more restrictive.
audit_tests.remediation: Run the following command to modify the file permissions of the --client-ca-file chmod 644 <filename>

audit_tests.name: 4.1.8 Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root
audit_tests.description: Ensure that the certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root.
audit_tests.remediation:
Remediation:
Run the following command to modify the ownership of the --client-ca-file. chown root:root <filename>
